alert.note: Alert for Hill; Jack; Johnson; Palo Pinto; Parker; Stephens; Wise; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 26 at 2:17PM CDT until March 27 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF I-35... The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Red Flag Warning for areas along and west of Interstate 35, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT Sunday. * AFFECTED AREA...Along and west of Interstate 35 * TIMING...10 AM to 8 PM Sunday. * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Upper 80s and lower 90s. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly. Prevention of fire starts is encouraged by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to producing sparks that can stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
